chapter.title: Chapter 1
The Locust Plague
chapter.verse: The word of Yahweh that came to Joel, son of Pethuel.
Hear this, you elders, and listen carefully, all you who live in the land. Has anything like this ever happened in your days or in your ancestors' days?
Tell your children about it, let your children tell their children, and their children the next generation.

What the cutting locust left, the swarming locust has eaten; what the swarming locust left, the hopping locust has eaten; and what the hopping locust left, the destroying locust has eaten.Hebrew uses four different words for locusts: gazam, arbeh, yeleq, hasil.
Wake up, you drunkards, and weep! Wail, all you wine drinkers, because the sweet wine has been cut off from your mouths.
For a nation has come up against my land, powerful and without number. Its teeth are lion's teeth, and it has the fangs of a lioness.
It has made my vine a wasteland and splintered my fig tree. It has stripped off the bark and thrown it away; the branches have turned white.
Grieve like a virgin dressed in rough cloth mourning for the husband of her youth.
chapter.title: Mourning for the Land
chapter.verse: Grain offerings and drink offerings have been cut off from Yahweh's house. The priests, who serve Yahweh, mourn.
The fields are destroyed; the land grieves because grain is destroyed, new wine has dried up, and olive oil has failed.
Be ashamed, you farmers! Wail, you vineyard workers, over the wheat and barley, because the harvest of the field has perished.
The grapevine has dried up, and the fig tree has withered; the pomegranate, the date palm, and the apple—all the trees of the field have dried up. Indeed, joy has dried up among the people.
chapter.title: Call to Repentance
chapter.verse: Dress in rough cloth and lament, you priests! Wail, you who serve at the altar! Come, spend the night in rough cloth, you who serve my God, because grain and drink offerings are withheld from your God's house.
Set apart a fast! Call a sacred assembly! Gather the elders and all the residents of the land to the house of Yahweh your God, and cry out to Yahweh!
What a terrible day! For the day of Yahweh is near and will come as destruction from the Almighty.Hebrew שַׁדַּי (Shaddai), meaning "Almighty" or "All-sufficient One."
Hasn't food been cut off before our eyes, joy and gladness from our God's house?
The seeds shrivel under their clods; the storehouses are desolate; the granaries are torn down, for the grain has withered.
How the animals groan! The herds of cattle wander in confusion since they have no pasture. Even the flocks of sheep suffer.
I call to you, Yahweh, for fire has consumed the pastures of the wilderness, and flames have devoured all the trees of the field.
Even the wild animals cry out to you, for the river beds have dried up, and fire has consumed the pastures of the wilderness.

chapter.title: Chapter 2
The Army of Locusts
chapter.verse: Blow the horn in Zion; sound the alarm on my set apart mountain! Let all the residents of the land tremble, for the day of Yahweh is coming; it is near—

a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and total darkness, like dawn spreading over the mountains. A great and mighty army comes, such as never was from ancient times, and never will be again through the years of many generations.
Fire devours in front of them, and behind them a flame burns. The land in front of them is like the garden of Eden, but behind them, it becomes a desolate wilderness. Nothing at all escapes them.
Their appearance is like that of horses; they gallop like war horses.
They bound on the tops of the mountains. Listen! The sound is like rumbling chariots, like crackling fire consuming stubble, like a mighty army lined up for battle.
Nations writhe in horror before them; all faces turn pale.Hebrew word parur means "turn pale."
They attack like warriors; they scale walls like soldiers. Each proceeds on his own path, and they do not change course.
They do not push each other; each man proceeds on his own path. They plunge through the weapons and are not stopped.
They storm the city; they run on the wall; they climb into the houses; they enter through the windows like thieves.
The earth quakes before them; the sky shakes. The sun and moon grow dark, and the stars stop shining.
Yahweh raises his voice in the presence of his army. His camp is very large; those who carry out his command are powerful. The day of Yahweh is great and very awesome. Who can endure it?
chapter.title: Call to Change Your Mind
chapter.verse: "Even now"—this is Yahweh's declaration—"turn to me with all your heart, with fasting, weeping, and mourning."
Tear your hearts, not just your clothes, and return to Yahweh your God. For he is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger, abounding in faithful love, and he relents from sending disaster.
Who knows? He may turn around and show compassion and leave a blessing behind him—grain and drink offerings for Yahweh your God.
Blow the horn in Zion! Set apart a fast; call a sacred assembly.
Gather the people; set apart the congregation; assemble the aged; gather the children, even babies nursing at the breast. Let the groom leave his bedroom, and the bride her chamber.

Let the priests, Yahweh's ministers, weep between the portico and the altar. Let them say: "Have pity on your people, Yahweh, and do not make your inheritance a disgrace, an object of scorn among the nations. Why should it be said among the peoples, 'Where is their God?'"
chapter.title: Yahweh's Response and Promises
chapter.verse: Then Yahweh became jealous for his land and had compassion on his people.
Yahweh answered his people: "Look, I am about to send you grain, new wine, and olive oil. You will be satisfied with them, and I will no longer make you a disgrace among the nations.

I will drive the northern army far from you and banish it to a dry and desolate land, its front ranks to the eastern sea, and its rear guard to the western sea. Its stench will rise; its stink will go up, for it has done great things."
Don't be afraid, land; rejoice and be glad, for Yahweh has done great things.
Don't be afraid, wild animals, for the pastures of the wilderness have turned green, the trees bear their fruit, and the fig tree and grapevine yield their riches.
Children of Zion, rejoice and be glad in Yahweh your God, because he gives you the autumn rain for your vindication. He sends showers for you—both autumn and spring rain as before.
The threshing floors will be full of grain, and the vats will overflow with new wine and olive oil.
"I will restore to you the years that the swarming locust ate, the hopping locust, the destroying locust, and the cutting locust—my great army that I sent against you.
You will have plenty to eat and be satisfied. You will praise the name of Yahweh your God, who has dealt wondrously with you. My people will never again be put to shame.
You will know that I am present in Israel and that I am Yahweh your God, and there is no other. My people will never again be put to shame.
chapter.title: God's Spirit Poured Out
chapter.verse: "After this I will pour out my Spirit on all humanity. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will have dreams, and your young men will see visions.
I will even pour out my Spirit on the male and female servants in those days.
I will display wonders in the heavens and on the earth: blood, fire, and columns of smoke.
The sun will be turned to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and awesome day of Yahweh comes.
Then everyone who calls on the name of Yahweh will be saved, for there will be an escape for those on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, as Yahweh promised, among the survivors Yahweh calls.

chapter.title: Chapter 3
Judgment of the Nations
chapter.verse: "Yes, in those days and at that time, when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,

I will gather all the nations and take them to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. I will enter into judgment with them there because of my people, my inheritance Israel. The nations have scattered my people among the countries and divided up my land.
They cast lots for my people; they traded boys for prostitutes and sold girls for wine to drink.
"And also, Tyre, Sidon, and all the regions of Philistia—what are you to me? Are you paying me back or trying to get even with me? I will quickly bring your actions back on your own heads.
For you took my silver and gold and carried my finest treasures to your temples.
You sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks to remove them far from their homeland.
Look, I am about to rouse them up from the place where you sold them; I will bring your actions back on your own heads.
I will sell your sons and daughters into the hands of the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, to a distant nation, for Yahweh has spoken."
chapter.title: Judgment in the Valley of Decision
chapter.verse: Proclaim this among the nations: Prepare for war set apart for God; rouse the warriors; let all the men of war advance and attack!
Beat your plows into swords and your pruning knives into spears. Let even the weakest say, "I am a warrior."
Come quickly, all you surrounding nations; gather there. Bring down your warriors, Yahweh!
Let the nations be roused and come to the Valley of Jehoshaphat, for there I will sit down to judge all the surrounding nations.
Swing the sickle because the harvest is ripe. Come and trample the grapes because the winepress is full; the wine vats overflow because the wickedness of the nations is extreme.
Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision! The day of Yahweh is near in the valley of decision.
The sun and moon will grow dark, and the stars will cease their shining.
Yahweh roars from Zion and makes his voice heard from Jerusalem; heaven and earth shake. But Yahweh will be a refuge for his people, a stronghold for the Israelites.
chapter.title: Blessings for God's People
chapter.verse: "Then you will know that I am Yahweh your God, who dwells in Zion, my set apart mountain. Jerusalem will be set apart for God, and foreigners will never overrun it again.

In that day the mountains will drip with sweet wine, and the hills will flow with milk. All the streams of Judah will flow with water, and a spring will issue from Yahweh's house, watering the Valley of Acacias.Hebrew shittim means "acacia trees."
Egypt will become desolate, and Edom a desert wasteland, because of the violence done to the people of Judah in whose land they shed innocent blood.
But Judah will be inhabited forever, and Jerusalem from generation to generation.
I will pardon their bloodguilt, which I have not pardoned, for Yahweh dwells in Zion."
